channel.title: CVE Feed for WPPOOL -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WPPOOL -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-30437|2024-03-29T17:22:36.216Z -- wppool -- webinar%20and%20video%20conference%20with%20jitsi%20meet
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WPPOOL Webinar and Video Conference with Jitsi Meet allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Webinar and Video Conference with Jitsi Meet: from n/a through 2.6.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-5449|2024-06-06T03:32:54.926Z -- wppool -- wp%20dark%20mode%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20dark%20mode%20plugin%20for%20improved%20accessibility%2C%20dark%20theme%2C%20night%20mode%2C%20and%20social%20sharing
item.description: The WP Dark Mode â€“ WordPress Dark Mode Plugin for Improved Accessibility, Dark Theme, Night Mode, and Social Sharing plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the wpdm_social_share_save_options function in all versions up to, and including, 5.0.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update the plugin's settings.
